main event: A glowing, elongated object the size of a grapefruit was observed for 3 seconds in the sky in front of the observer's car near Winnfield, Louisiana.
interesting points: The object was glowing white and had a tail about half the size of the main body.
The object was first seen at a 45-degree elevation and disappeared at a 25-degree elevation, moving in a straight line to the northwest.
The sighting occurred at dusk on a clear, mild day with calm surface conditions.
The observer, a 52-year-old equipment operator, was estimated to be of good reliability.
The object's behavior and appearance were inconsistent with a meteor or jet aircraft afterburner, leading the investigator to conclude the sighting was unexplained.
sighted object: glowing, elongated object the size of a grapefruit
